intro: Mirbelia confertiflora, commonly known as the broad-flowered mirbelia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Mirbelia confertiflora is often found in coastal and inland regions of Western Australia.
